result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J. Manteuffel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No violent contact whatsoever with victim, K.M.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

SAFE program or like/equivalent program completion.  Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.  DNA sample.

ADDRESS INFO for Travis J. Manteuffel

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 3:36pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Thomas Wilmouth.
Probation/Parole Review Hearing.

State notes programming ordered regarding SAFE program; Probation Dept requesting conditions of probation.

COURT addresses Safe Program condition - If Dept in its discretion determines there is an alternative program that they will accept instead of SAFE program, it is their perogative.

State is not requesting any modification of probation - Dept is requesting clarification of no contact order between defendant and victim; COURT notes all conditions remain in place at this time as originally ordered.

Adj: 3:44pm

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM1125 and 15CM1490 called: 10:06am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Thomas Wilmouth.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
15CM1125 - Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>AMEND to County DC pursuant to 9.01
15CM1490 - Cts. 1, 2 and 4>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CM1125 - Ct. 1 (County DC)>>GUILTY
15CM1490 - Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.
Atty Wilmouth makes statement; Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: 
15CM1125>>$25+CC; Defendant may set up payment plan at COC.
15CM1490>> 60 days MCJ w/credit for 12 days of time alreayd served, (no huber awarded), I&S; 1 year Probation
CONDITIONS: Safe program or like/equivalent program completion; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC including D.A. surcharge; DNA sample and surcharge; No possession of dangerous weapons; No violent contact whatsoever with victim K.M.

Adj: 10:16am
Stipulation and Proposed Order to Modify Conditions of Release - signed 1/28/16 - includes 15CM1125 & 15CM1490

Defendant's Motion for Modification of Conditions of Release - stj
**Includes 15CM1490 & 15CM1125

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM1125 and 15CM1490 called: 1:18pm
State appears by ADA  M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Bliss
(Motion re: Bond Modification)

Atty Bliss notes Motion filed 8/25 requesting lifting of no contact provision and lifting provision prohibiting defendant from residing in any household where firearms are located.
State makes argument on bond modifications requested.
Victim makes statement on request for bond modification.

COURT modifies bond in both cases as follows>> $2500 sign bond w/1st $500 cash (already posted) w/conditions: Defendant cannot have contact w/K.M. except communicate by phone, text or email for child, travel to and attend medical appointments for their child together; defendant can be at K.M.'s residence for sole purpose of providing day care for child and incidental contact that occurs when defendant is at residence before leaving and after returning home; Any contact w/K.M cannot be physical violent or abusive whatsoever.
COURT denies modification regarding firearms -- that condition continues that defendant cannot reside at any home where firearms are located.

Further argument on bond by Atty Bliss regarding firearms - COURT leaves bond as stated above.

Adj: 1:39pm
RECALLED: 1:40pm -- same appearances
COURT notes for record that once case adjourned, defendant used profane language and slammed chair in table
COURT finds defendant in contempt - COURT gives defendant opportunity to make statement.
Defendant makes statement on his contempt finding and bond conditions.
COURT warns defendant against future behavior.
COURT will not impose any penalty at this time.

Adj: 1:46pm

AMENDED.  $2500.00 signature bond with first $500.00 in cash.  Includes 15CM1125 and 15CM1490.  Defendant cannot have contact with K.M. except communicate by phone, text or email for child, travel to and attend medical appointments for their child together.  Defendant can be at K.M.'s residence for sole purpose of providing day care for child and incidental contact that occurs when defendant is at residence before leaving and after returning home.  Any contact with K.M. cannot be physical violent or abusive whatsoever.

AMENDED.  $2500.00 signature bond with first $500.00 in cash.  Includes 15CM1125 and 15CM1490. Defendant can be at K.M.'s residence for sole purpose of providing day care for child and incidental contact that occurs when defendant is at residence before leaving and after returning home.  Any contact with K.M. cannot be physical violent or abusive whatsoever.

Clerk Becky/Cheree

Date and time set for plea.

DATES SET:  FPT 09/10/15 @ 9 am

COURT directs deft to contact PD's office ASAP
